MENU.itemDescr: First List Item in Choose A Project page of Wizard

SUB_MENU.subMenuHelp: Create a new document
Open an existing document
Save the active document
Save the document with different xml format, or different filename
Close the active document
Pack document for transfer to another computer
Unpack a document that was packed on another computer
Print the active document
Show what printed pages will look like (without printing)
Change the printing options
Show the sequence of dialog windows used for accessing a project and working on documents
Save the knowledge base and document, then close this project
Change to a different book folder for document storage (book mode must be ON)
Update the knowledge base file for this project
Make a new knowledge base backup immediately
Use all the saved documents to rebuild the knowledge base file
Quit the application; prompts to save documents
Undo the last action
Cut the selection and put it on the Clipboard
Copy the selection and put it on the Clipboard
Insert Clipboard contents
Go to a specific chapter and verse
Edit the selected source text
Check all translations with those in the knowledge base for consistency
Move the note forward in the document to the next word or phrase
Move the note backward in the document to the previous word or phrase
Adapt It settings
Show or hide the toolbar
Show or hide the status bar
Show or hide the bar for composing text
Copy source text to phrase box as default translation
Start a new strip whenever a standard format marker is encountered
Units to be used when printing
Change the language of the program interface. You may need to restart Adapt It for the change to take effect
Find text in source or target or both, or special search
Replace in target text
Define and load one or more consistent changes tables
Unload any loaded consistent changes tables
Use the consistent changes when copying source text
Accept the changed source text as the translation and continue on
Load an SIL Converter
Use a loaded SIL Converter
Display dialog for editing the knowledge base
Use automatic capitalization when copying source text
Output a file listing all retranslations
Split the document into two or more documents
Join two or more documents into a single document
Move documents between the Adaptations folder and a book folder location
Export the source language text as a *.txt file type
Export the target language translation as a *.txt file type
Export the Source and Target languages in interlinear form as an *.rtf file type
Export the glossing lines' contents as text
Collect all the free translation sections' contents, adding standard format markers, and export
Export the translation text according to the OXES version 1 standard
Export knowledge base in standard format or LIFT format
Extend knowledge base by importing dictionary records
Make glossing line visible on screen
Use the navigation text font for glossing text
Transform adaptations from another project into the current project's glosses
Slow automatic insertions down to a speed suitable for reading along
Turn on, or off, storage of documents to book folders
Turn on, or off, typing of free translations in the Compose Bar and displaying them in the main window

SUB_MENU.subMenuLabel: Use Target Text As Default Free Translation
SUB_MENU.subMenuHelp: Turn on, or off, composition of a default free translation from the existing target text

SUB_MENU.subMenuLabel: Use Gloss Text As Default Free Translation
SUB_MENU.subMenuHelp: Turn on, or off, composition of a default free translation from the existing gloss text
Removes all the filtered free translations in the document
Collect adaptations, or glosses, and store them with a back translation marker as filtered material
Deletes all the filtered back translations in the document
Select this item to use SIL Converters in transliteration mode
Select this item to cause applications such as Paratext and TW to automatically scroll to the same location
Select this item to cause Adapt It to scroll to the same location being displayed in other applications such as Paratext and TW
Layout text in window from right to left
List Help topics
Get Adapt It Help from the Internet in your browser
Select this item to turn on or turn off tooltip help messages
Display program information, version number and copyright
